intro: Frangula glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth buckthorn, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its dark green, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in the spring. The plant is notable for its smooth, barkless stems and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. Its fruits are small, dark berries that ripen in the fall and are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Frangula glaberrima is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks.
